title: How to Paint Your Nails Without Making a Mess

steps.title: Find some liquid Elmers glue.
steps.content: Find some liquid Elmers glue. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Smear it around your nail.
steps.content: Smear it around your nail. Place it directly on your skin, using a cotton swab. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Start painting your nails as usual.
steps.content: Start painting your nails as usual. Use appropriate care, knowing however that small brush strokes onto the skin will be easy to remove. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Peel off the glue after use.
steps.content: Peel off the glue after use. It will lift up any nail polish that went onto it. Dispose of appropriately. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Get rid of any leftover glue as follows:
steps.content: Get rid of any leftover glue as follows: Dip a napkin in water, and spread where the glue is still stuck to your skin. Doing this will make it easier to get rid of. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put petroleum jelly or petroleum jelly around your whole nail.
steps.content: Put petroleum jelly or petroleum jelly around your whole nail. Do this for each nail. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Paint the nails as usual.
steps.content: Paint the nails as usual. If any excess polish is on your skin, all you need to do is wipe off the petroleum jelly and the mess is all gone. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Wash your hands once the polish has firmly dried.
steps.content: Wash your hands once the polish has firmly dried. [8] X Research source
